subject: Web3
title: NFT Marketplaces
description: A fast breakdown of NFT Marketplaces for builders.

hook.text: OpenSea became the Amazon of NFTs. At its peak, it processed over $5 billion in monthly trading volume.

buildup.text: Marketplaces like OpenSea, Rarible, and Magic Eden let anyone list, browse, and buy NFTs with crypto.

discovery.text: OpenSea charged a 2.5% fee on every sale. At peak volume, it generated hundreds of millions in revenue.

twist.text: Blur launched in 2022 with lower fees and token rewards. It stole most of OpenSea's volume overnight.

climax.text: The marketplace wars showed that loyalty is thin in crypto. Users follow the lowest fees and best incentives.

punchline.text: The biggest NFT marketplace lost its crown to a cheaper rival.

quiz.question: What disrupted OpenSea's dominance?
options: Blur offered lower fees and token rewards
